page.title: 08The Sea.
page.content:
One of our worst wrecks was at Donna Nook on a terrible night with a force 10 gale. There were 22 people on board the ship and nearly all were drowned.The worst job for a coast guard is to find dead bodies just lying on the beach motionless.We used to have a lifeboat in Sutton which was kept where the Meridale Youth Club is now.The coastguard service has been gradually built up. High tides are caused by a full moon pulling the tide inland.We get a veryhigh tide when the sun helps the moon pull the tide inland.Most people drown through going in the sea on airbeds or rubber dinghys.
To find out the information about The Sea on the last four pages, we interviewed{Mr Middleton, Mr Morris and{Mr Sheard.
